questions.question: The kids broke ................................ as soon as they saw the buffoon.
questions.description: Break up can mean start laughing.

questions.question: It is a mystery how the prisoners managed to break .................................. of jail.
questions.description: To break out is to escape.

questions.question: I broke ......................................... a rash after taking a dip in the pond.
questions.description: To break out in something is to develop a skin condition.

questions.question: The news of his death brought me .....................................
questions.description: If something makes you down, it makes you unhappy.

questions.question: I don't like it when you bring ................................................ politics.
questions.description: To bring a topic up is to start talking about it.

questions.question: I called ...................................... but I could not find anyone to fix the roof.
questions.description: To call around is to phone many different places / people.

questions.question: He drew a blank when the professor called ........................................ him for question
questions.description: To call on somebody is to ask for an answer.

questions.question: Although I ran faster I couldn't catch ......................................... with her.
questions.description: To catch up with somebody is to get to the same point as them.

questions.question: The company checks ....................................... all applicants before hiring.
questions.description: To check somebody out is to investigate them.

questions.question: I bought the kids some chocolates to cheer them ..........................................
questions.description: To cheer somebody up is to make them happy.

questions.question: He has come .......................................... flu.
questions.description: To come down with something is to become sick.

questions.question: If you want to lose weight, you have to cut .............................................. sweets and burgers.
questions.description: To cut back on something is to consume less.
